title: Everything We Know About The Nintendo Switch
description:

transcript_chunks.text: what's up guys don't mind me I'm just chilling in front of a GameStop I love my video wall so much this is the greatest thing of all time so here's the deal GameStop came to us and they're like yo do you guys want to make videos that are going to be shown in all the GameStops all across America and we're like yeah that'd be pretty cool but then me and Greg put a lot of work into it so we were like hey we might as well put it on the channel so everyone else can see it but I don't want that to stop you from going out to GameStops and you know filming us and then tweeting at us and stuff because man that's just the type of people that we are but anyways hope you enjoy this stuff I know it's a little bit different than we normally do here on kind of funny games but hopefully you enjoy it what's up guys I'm Tim Gettys from kind of funny and after what felt like the longest waight of all time x finally gave it to us a Nintendo officially announced the Nintendo switch as a huge Nintendo fan I

up guys I'm Tim Gettys from kind of funny and after what felt like the longest waight of all time x finally gave it to us a Nintendo officially announced the Nintendo switch as a huge Nintendo fan I admit the last few months all right years whatever decade have been a little rough in terms of their decisions while I don't love the name I can live with calling it The NS and despite the undeniable quality of the first party games it's obvious that Nintendo knows they need to win back the hearts of Gamers the last year has been full of rumors of what project NX might be and thankfully it looks like most of the good ones turned out to be true here's everything we know about the Nintendo switch let's be real it's what the Wii U should have been set for a release in March 2017 it's a hybrid home/ portable device that uses 3DS style carts allowing you to play console quality experiences in your living room or on the go and unlike the Wii U Wii U were limited to staying about 20 ft from the

portable device that uses 3DS style carts allowing you to play console quality experiences in your living room or on the go and unlike the Wii U Wii U were limited to staying about 20 ft from the system before it lost signal the mobile device is the system allowing you to play outside in a car on a plane or even at a party whatever do you and while the Wii U reveal focused on families the switch announcement video doesn't have a child in sight definitely a good sign the other key thing is that has a ton of different control options the little side controllers called joycons detached and can be used as individual controllers but nah none of us are going to actually do that we're either going to attach them to this thing creating what's called The Joy grip controller or more likely using a Nintendo switch PR controller and playing games like a real person who thought people wanted symmetrical analog sticks on top of the buttons shame on you Nintendo come on at least you're trying to fix

switch PR controller and playing games like a real person who thought people wanted symmetrical analog sticks on top of the buttons shame on you Nintendo come on at least you're trying to fix it but honestly the most important thing is games and Nintendo is killing it in that regard in addition to the definitive version of The Legend of Zelda breath of the wild new versions of Mario Kart 8 and Splatoon show that many amazing Wii U games will be getting much deserved second lives hopefully hinting at an extended catalog of enhanced ports of titles like Super Smash Brothers and Captain Toad to Pat out the switch's catalog whether or not your sport fan the sales of the NBA 2K franchise are undeniable and speaking of mainstream popularity it's kind of nuts to see Skyrim running on a Nintendo platform but again as a Nintendo fan there's nothing better than seeing a proper new entry in the 3D Mario franchise seemingly in the style of Super Mario 64 but what does it mean for the 3DS and Wii

platform but again as a Nintendo fan there's nothing better than seeing a proper new entry in the 3D Mario franchise seemingly in the style of Super Mario 64 but what does it mean for the 3DS and Wii U well on the 3DS we got Pokemon Sun and Moon Super Mario Maker 3DS in December and poochi and Yoshi's worldly World in February then on the Wii U well Pokemon snaps available now Virtual Console so I I guess there's that but that's kind of the point Nintendo realized they messed up and are trying to fix it since the N64 they've always had two major issues third party support and putting out games consistently without month-long droughts to attempt to remedy this they released a sampling of developers and Publishers referred to as quote Nintendo switch partners and while showing off images with a bunch of logos is part for the course when it comes to new hardware the 3DS announcement featured 21 companies and the Wii U only had 10 so the 48 the switch has at the very least is a step in

with a bunch of logos is part for the course when it comes to new hardware the 3DS announcement featured 21 companies and the Wii U only had 10 so the 48 the switch has at the very least is a step in the right direction especially when we're talking about Bethesda and th software just stop and imagine a portable Dark Souls game now in terms of release schedule the 3DS and Wii U both had incredible games they were just released way way too far apart from each other Nintendo's referring to the switch as their quote new home gaming system which is important because it shows that this is their premium offering imagine if all of Nintendo's first and second parties were focused on one platform instead of two add some third party support a couple indie games and all of a sudden we are looking at a very solid lineup at least on the portable sides this seems like what the PSP and Playstation vaita always tried to be but with the added promise of consistent amazing first party games don't take

a very solid lineup at least on the portable sides this seems like what the PSP and Playstation vaita always tried to be but with the added promise of consistent amazing first party games don't take this one from me guys I need it just let's roll with it and see how long the good news lasts Nintendo seems to be nailing it so far but obviously we still have a ton of questions price battery life specs is it a touchcreen are there motion sensors what's up with the miios how about virtual consolle does it have a trophy or Achievement System does the home dock ad processing power what is external storage look like where's Metroid will we see Final Fantasy 7 remake could we get an exclusive Final Fantasy 6 remake a proper console Pokémon thankfully it seems like most of our questions will get answered at Nintendo switch presentation live streamed on January 12th but for all your NS analysis and prediction needs you should check out kind of funny gamescast on youtube.com/ kindof funnygames
